answers.answer: Would be that I do drink a lot of alcohol.  at least 5 drinks a night and on the weekends probalby 10.This, I assume, can be a contributor.  The one answer I got from the HIV forum here is that I do not have hiv because none of my symptoms are characteristic. Which I concur.  But if it WERE to be hiv related it would be later stage hiv. I would think at later stage hiv though, that I would have a lot more things to worry about than just some abscesses on my ***.I've always been a pretty frequently-sick person.  I get the flu or colds when anyone has them.  And I've had light skin problems my whole life. light eczema or light psoriasis I guess it would be.

question: Over the last number of months I have had recurrent problems with abscesses, furuncles, and follicalitus all around 'the underpants area".I was frequenting spas, not for sex, but for massages and occasional hand jobs.  I figured the hygiene in those places not being so high was the cause of some staph infection.  But it continues. I don't think i am hiv positive but am worried to hell that i am.  I have never had any of the symptoms of hiv,and haven't had unprotected vaginal sex with anyone of a positive status.  I am not gay or a drug injector.Still, my problem obviously suggest immune system problem.I believe diabetes is the primary possibility.  my anxiety is really really high because I'm thinking the worst.
title: recurrent skin problems around my thighs and buttocks
